result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Laboratory report filed by the State.
Motion hearing on November 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress, filed by Attorney Jochman.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 9/16/2022 - Given the Branch 2 jury trial next week, the 9/21 hearing will be cancelled and a motion hearing will be scheduled with the parties.**

9:42 AM Defendant Jesse M Klim Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Tyler A Jochman in court for Jesse M Klim Jr. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 
Cases called to address the motion to modify bond in 22CF1235.

Atty Jochman makes arguments on the record.
State objects to any modification to bond.
Court declines the motion to modify bond. 

Defense has received discovery and requests time to review. 
Court adjourns hearing set for later this month.
Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on August 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Motion to Modify Bond

**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 08/12/22--Set for Bail/bond hearing; if necessary the Court authorizes a court commissioner to address this motion due to the availability of Branch 2 next week.**
Hearing on August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:36 AM Defendant Jesse M Klim in court, in custody, with attorney Tyler A Jochman.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  
Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Preliminary hearing on August 8, 2022 at 09:15 am.

01:24 PM Defendant Jesse M Klim in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
The Defendant waives the 10 days, however requests prelim within 20 days.
The Court will adjourn.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:15 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.

Hearing on July 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

02:14 PM Defendant Jesse M Klim in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Clerk of Court to notify Public Defender's Office to evaluate defendant tomorrow morning.  The Court will set this matter back for tomorrow with the hope the defendant has been evaluated by then.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
